sdumitriu - (12:57): CalebJamesDeLisl: Ping  
nuvolari is now known as weetbix (~JBouncer@unaffiliated/nuvolari  
weetbix is now known as bokomo (~JBouncer@unaffiliated/nuvolari  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:01): sdumitriu: Ping  
sdumitriu - (13:02): Did you try the bug on Oracle?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:03): No, I don't have Oracle. Do you know if it's free?  
sdumitriu - (13:03): I tried a couple of times to get one installed  
sdumitriu - (13:03): I think there is a free (cost) version for Linux  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:04): I will try putting it on. I looked for information about an equivalent to allowMultiQueries but was unsuccessful.  
nickless left at 13:22 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:34): Blagh 2Gb of data and an awful license. Pretty sure they can keep their database.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:34): Found this though: http://www.red-database-security.com/wp/oracle\_sql\_injection\_2009.pdf  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:35): Page 27: Integers or strings can be replaces with queries.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:35): Also I found that \ is indeed an escape character.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:36): Looks like \_any\_ injection in oracle is total destruction.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:39): What would be really cool would be search(ArrayList<Object>)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:40): $xwiki.search('select XWikiDocument as doc where doc.space=', $space, ' and doc.name=', $name)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:41): oops I mean $xwiki.search(['....])  
Denis left at 13:53 (Quit: Leaving.  
annacondan joined #xwiki at 13:57  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 14:07  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:32): sdumitriu: A little more playing with mysql and I just dumped xwikistrings using union.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:34): So I guess everyone is affected except hsql (?)  
sdumitriu - (14:34): Union?  
sdumitriu - (14:34): How come?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:35): How come everyone is affected?  
sdumitriu - (14:37): How come union triggers it?  
sdumitriu - (14:37): Can you send me (private) the query you used?  
sdumitriu - (14:38): Ah that kind of dumped  
sdumitriu - (14:39): But I think that's possible with a normal query, isn't it?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:40): No, a normal HQL query is constrained to listing document names.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:40): HQL has no union function.

annacondan left at 15:51 (Quit: annacondan  
tmortagne - (16:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: even without anything in configurationClass i still get the SAVE button in the bottom of the content when viewing admin  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 16:08  
tmortagne - (16:11): CalebJamesDeLisl: i need a really custom content and not something inside a single form (I have some status UI and different forms)  
anamarias - (16:12): hi  
anamarias - (16:12): what do you make of this exception: http://ana-s-private-labs.pastebin.com/ZucTpj2w ?  
anamarias - (16:12): it's an PDF  
anamarias - (16:12): it happens on some PDFs, not all  
anamarias - (16:13): and everytime, on several machines the same  
sdumitriu - (16:14): The attachment content is not actually in the database  
sdumitriu - (16:14): Is it a big one?  
anamarias - (16:15): not really, it has 852KB  
plunden left #xwiki at 16:17  
sdumitriu - (16:17): If you try to attach it to another document, then call $xwiki.flushCache(), then download it, does it work?  
anamarias - (16:17): ah wait !  
anamarias - (16:17): at Attachments  
anamarias - (16:17): it  
anamarias - (16:18): it says:  
anamarias - (16:18):  break.pdf   Delete  Edit   1.1  
anamarias - (16:18): Posted by Administrator on 2010/04/27 13:15 (0 bytes)  
anamarias - (16:18): so it has 0 bytes  
anamarias - (16:19): but there was no warning while updating it, to say an error happened  
anamarias - (16:19): or why does upload fails?  
sdumitriu - (16:20): There should be an error in the log, but it's not displayed  
oanat left at 16:28 (Quit: Leaving.  
anamarias - (16:31): sdumitriu: I found the file attachment upload exception, it does say something about being too large: http://ana-s-private-labs.pastebin.com/096ZyaH1  
anamarias - (16:32): but the file on disk is still 853KB  
sdumitriu - (16:32): Yes, the file is base64 encoded  
sdumitriu - (16:32): So it gets bigger  
sdumitriu - (16:32): That's a mysql setting  
anamarias - (16:33): so the mysql setting needs to be changed?  
sdumitriu - (16:33): Yes  
anamarias - (16:33): how big should it be? to allow pdf attachment even bigger ~MB in size  
sdumitriu - (16:34): http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Howtoincreasethemaximumattachmentsize  
anamarias - (16:35): cool :) thanks  
sdumitriu - (16:35): http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/packet-too-large.html

gvallarelli - (19:43): through mailing list, I've seen the annocement of XWiki new release, I'll notify my professor about XWiki because he uses wiki for students :)
